org.qbroker.jms

Class EventEscalator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.qbroker.jms.EventEscalator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EventEscalation

    public class EventEscalator
extends java.lang.Object
implements EventEscalation
    EventEscalator maintains a session for selected events to keep tracking a specific number as the indicator of the state change across the time line. The number being tracked can be either the sum of the number specified by TrackedField of each event within the session, or the total number of the events in the session if TrackedField is not defined. The method of escalate() will calculate the number based on the incoming event and the session cache. If the number falls into the predefined EscalationRange, a new event will be generated as the escalation. If Type is set to MessageEscalator, the returned event will be a TextEvent as a JMS Message.

    EventEscalator implements EventEscalation. It provides a way to correlate the same sort of events across the time line.
    Author:
    yannanlu@yahoo.com

      • getEscalationOrder

        public int getEscalationOrder()
        Description copied from interface: EventEscalation
        It returns an integer as the escalation order that determines if the escalation event to be processed before the original event or not. If the escalation order is ORDER_FISRT, the escalation event should be processed before the original event. If it is ORDER_LAST, the escalation event should be processed after. If it is ORDER_NONE, which one is the first does not matter.
        Specified by:
        getEscalationOrder in interface EventEscalation
